Activity: Log in, check emails. Follow up on the email to @da-1 and @da-2 regarding data element clarification. Review yesterday's progress and identify any outstanding issues.
Begin verifying the presence of symptom data (e.g., cough, fever, sore throat) in the EHR system. Pay close attention to the use of standardized terminologies (e.g., SNOMED CT, ICD-10).

If response received from @da-1 and @da-2: Review the clarification and update the verification checklist accordingly. If no response: Send a reminder email to @da-1 and @da-2: "Gentle Reminder: Data Element Verification - Clarification Request".
Continue verifying the presence of lab result data (e.g., influenza A/B test results). Check for the presence of relevant lab codes and numerical values. Note any inconsistencies.

Contact @clinlead-1 via email: "Inquiry Regarding Symptom Documentation". Inquire about the standard procedures for documenting influenza symptoms and any potential challenges faced by clinicians in accurately capturing this information.

Begin reviewing medication data (prescriptions) related to influenza treatment. Verify the presence of drug names, dosages, and administration routes. Identify any cases with missing or inappropriate prescriptions.

Compile a list of strategies for minimizing future data gaps, based on the data issues identified during verification. Consider potential interventions such as data entry training, system modifications, and automated data quality checks.
Update the progress report for @itpm-1 with the latest findings and proposed strategies for addressing missing data. Highlight any areas where additional support or resources are needed.
